documents.title: top judges throw out derby mans bid to clear name
text: a derby man has had a bid to clear his name thrown out by top judges .
steven robert green is currently serving 23 years for sex crimes against three schoolgirls .
green , of warner street , was jailed last april and was described as a depraved `` monster '' .
his legal team argued that his trial was unfair because the judge 's summing-up to the jury was `` unbalanced '' .
however , lady justice hallett threw out his complaints - saying his sentence was `` robust but amply justified '' .
author: Khia Lewis-Todd
BBC Local Live

documents.title: sudbury absconder captured in nuneaton
text: and another absconder has been captured by police .
jamie lee biddle who absconded from hmp sudbury last november has been recaptured in nuneaton .
biddle was arrested by warwickshire police on 30 january and has been charged with escaping lawful custody .
the 26-year-old was serving an indeterminate term of imprisonment for wounding with intent .

documents.title: 'there is no obvious cause or explanation '
text: lucy wilkinson , a senior cardiac nurse at the british heart foundation , spoke to us earlier .
she said : `` it 's about being aware about our bodies .
unfortunately for many families the first sign for the problem is when people die suddenly and there is no obvious cause or explanation .
`` increasing the research and finding out more about these inherited heart conditions means we will have better ways of treatment and better ways of diagnosing people . ''
author: Andrew Strachan
Reporter, BBC Radio Derby

documents.title: thousands at risk due to faulty heart gene
text: almost 10,000 people in derbyshire are at risk of dying suddenly from a faulty heart gene .
on average 12 young , seemingly healthy people die without warning every week in the uk because of an unknown heart condition .
a senior cardiac nurse at the british heart foundation said the lack of symptoms for the condition make avoiding it difficult .
author: Andrew Strachan
Reporter, BBC Radio Derby

documents.title: missing hadfield man
text: billy burns was last seen this morning at hadfield railway station at about 8:35 .
the 76-year-old boarded a train to ashburys in manchester , where he was due to arrive at 9:12 .
mr burns , who suffers from dementia , got of the train at one of the eight stops in between the two stations .
he is 5ft 8in with curly grey hair and was wearing a blue anorak , grey trousers and black shoes .
mr burns was also carrying a walking stick .
author: Khia Lewis-Todd
BBC Local Live

documents.title: museum 'unlikely ' to buy painting
text: derby museums have said they 're unlikely to purchase the joseph wright painting found in belper .
the portrait is thought to have been painted in 1783 and is expected to fetch between £ 2,000 to £ 3,000 at auction in march .

jonathan wallis from derby museums said they 're not able to buy paintings for their collection in the current financial climate , unless they 're particularly important in understanding wright as an artist .
mr wallis said this painting was unlikely to fall into that category .
author: Khia Lewis-Todd
BBC Local Live

documents.title: thousands expected for chatsworth flower show
text: some good news is coming your way , if you are a keen flower lover .
around 80 show gardens and 80,000 visitors are expected at the first ever chatsworth flower show this summer .
this will be the royal horticultural society 's first new show in 12 years .
it will feature a floral marquee centred on a 14 metre dome and bridges will link two sides of the show across the river derwent .
author: Sally Swinfen
BBC Radio Derby newsreader

documents.title: by-election for the derwent ward
text: a by-election will be held in derby on 9 march , for the vacant city council seat in the derwent ward .
the sitting councillor , ukip 's bill wright , died of a heart attack over christmas .
candidates will need to register by the 10 february .
author: BBC Radio Derby

documents.title: new rules for shrovetide football
text: it may be centuries old and steeped in tradition but this year the rules for ashbourne 's royal shrovetide football have been changed .
the rules state that if the ball is goaled after 17:00 then the game finishes for the day but this year it will be extended until 17:30 .
giving them more time to score goals , they hope .
author: Khia Lewis-Todd
BBC Local Live

documents.title: 'will shape this country for generations '
text: speaking in the commons last night the derby north mp said :
`` now this is a decision that will shape this country for generations and it 's one we must respect and ensure it becomes a reality .
